intro: Goodyera casta, commonly known as the copper-leafed orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves that often have a reddish or copper-colored underside. The plant produces delicate, greenish-white flowers with a distinctive, spurred lip. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and forest floors. Goodyera casta is a perennial herb that thrives in cool, humid climates and is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora.
